meanings.definition: The actions or behavior of a huckster.
meanings.sent1: His hucksterisms were evident in the way he exaggerated the benefits of his products.
meanings.sent2: The community was tired of the hucksterisms of the dishonest salesman.
meanings.sent3: The hucksterisms of the con artist were so obvious that even a child could see through them.
meanings.sent4: Her hucksterisms were like a tangled web, trapping unsuspecting customers with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The hucksterisms of the street vendor echoed through the crowded market, luring in curious passersby.

meanings.definition: The deceptive or unethical practices of a huckster.
meanings.sent1: Exposing the hucksterisms of the scammer was crucial to protecting vulnerable individuals.
meanings.sent2: Consumers should be wary of falling for the hucksterisms of fraudulent advertisers.
meanings.sent3: The hucksterisms of the swindler were finally brought to light by an undercover investigation.
meanings.sent4: Her hucksterisms were like a poison, slowly eroding trust in the market.
meanings.sent5: The hucksterisms of the charlatan left a trail of disappointed customers in their wake.

meanings.definition: The selling techniques employed by a huckster.
meanings.sent1: The hucksterisms of the persuasive salesman convinced many to buy unnecessary products.
meanings.sent2: Recognizing the hucksterisms of the pushy vendor helped customers make informed choices.
meanings.sent3: The hucksterisms of the slick salesperson were no match for the savvy shopper.
meanings.sent4: Her hucksterisms were like a well-rehearsed performance, designed to close deals swiftly.
meanings.sent5: The hucksterisms of the auctioneer echoed in the room, creating an atmosphere of excitement and competition.
